result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd B Hillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Mark Kershek

Defendant Todd B Hillman in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding the restitution request discovery.  Attorney Juech requests to take a short recess.  Court reconvenes.  Victim makes statements.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Withheld Sentence:
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victim.
Sex offender assessment.
Condition Time: 10 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: $1974.05 to be paid to K.L.Z. as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Sentencing hearing at 03-02-2016 02:30 pm
reference letters on behalf of the defendant.

Case called for a sentencing hearing.  Defendant Todd B Hillman in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises the victim would like to speak along with her boyfriend.  Attorney Kershek makes statements in objection to having the boyfriend make statements.  Victim makes statements.  Victim is making a restitution request.  Court makes statements.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Court adjourns this matter so the State can forward the restitution documentation to the defense.  Documents need to be exchanged by 2/15/2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Todd B Hillman in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended in formation filed in Court, Attorney Kershek waives formal reading.  Defendant pleads no contest to the amended charge.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court sets this case for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Todd B Hillman in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court orders a court appointed counsel.  Court orders Mr. HIllman to pay $100.00 per month starting 4/20/2015.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
